itemDescription: British nurse, matron, government health official, health care engineer and educational philanthropist

wikipedia_page.main: Dame Kathleen Annie Raven, DBE, FRCN (9 November 1910, Coniston, Lancashire, England – 19 April 1999, Oxford, England) was a British nurse, matron, government health official, health care engineer, and educational philanthropist.

response: * Dame Kathleen Raven, nurse, Chief Nursing Officer in the DHSS from 1958–72

link_mentions.page: List of Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire
response: *1968: Zara Bate, Annis Gillie, Isabel Graham-Bryce, Mary Green, Muriel Powell, Kathleen Raven, Hilda Stevenson, Muriel Stewart, Dorothy Tangney, Veronica Wedgwood, Ethel Wormald

Dame Elizabeth Cockayne, DBE (29 October 1894 – 4 July 1988) was Chief Nursing Officer from the inception of the National Health Service in 1948 until her retirement a decade later in 1958. She was succeeded by Dame Kathleen Raven.

link_mentions.page: List of honorary graduates of the University of Leeds

response: * 1958 to 1972: Kathleen RavenSheila Quinn, 'Raven, Dame Kathleen Annie (1910–1999)', Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 18 Oct 2017
